conclusion: To determine the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph and identify the acceleration at each point.
At t = 0 seconds, the velocity is 20 m/s.
At t = 10 seconds, the velocity is 10 m/s.
At t = 15 seconds, the velocity is 0 m/s.
At t = 0 seconds, the acceleration is calculated as (20 m/s - 0 m/s) / 10 s = 2 m/s².
At t = 10 seconds, the acceleration is calculated as (10 m/s - 20 m/s) / 10 s = -1 m/s².
At t = 15 seconds, the acceleration is calculated as (0 m/s - 10 m/s) / 5 s = -2 m/s².
The acceleration is negative at t = 10 seconds and t = 15 seconds.
The direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is downward.
The final answer is that the direction of the acceleration during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is downward.
